utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: So, thank you for the delicious dinner.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're welcome for a delicious dinner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey what are you guys looking at?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross and the most beautiful girl in the world.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, come to papa.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where did you, when did you, how did you... How did you get a girl like that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, so what is she, like a... like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics instructor, what?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Actually she's a paleontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the centazoic era.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, but that's, like, the easiest era.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I've seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her dinner. We had a great time. And we're going out again tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can bring home the biggest geek.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine by me; hope she wins.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oo! Is it for my birthday present?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Phebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but remember you said you ordered something special, and it just hasn't come yet?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I have a call in about that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Kay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Actually, this is for Kathy's birthday. It's an early edition of her favorite book.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, The Velveteen Rabbit! Oh my God, when the boy's love makes the rabbit real!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, but don't touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh. Well, then you'd better keep it away from Ross's hair. So this is pretty rare. How did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, it wasn't a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked to a couple of dealers... called a couple of the author's grandchildren.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, honey, that's so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, and what a great way to say, "I secretly love you, roommate's girlfriend!"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It doesn't say that. Does it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How do you think it's gonna look when you get her something incredibly meaningful and expensive and her boyfriend Joey gives her an orange?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, all right, I'll just uh, make sure that uh, Joey gets her something really great.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's gotta be better than that book. Oo! Like a crossbow!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye. I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! What happened?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sixty guests.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, uh, why did you have to turn it down?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because I don't have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there's no way.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, what is with all the negativity? You sound like Monican't , not Monican... ...Monica. Look, you know, you have been playing around with this catering thing for over three years. Do you want to be a caterer or not?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There you go, that's the spirit! Okay! Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really? Cause I'd need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay! It's worth it, if it will get you moving. You haven't worked in months.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you're not working either.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, but I'm doing this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, that'd be great! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Can I borrow the keys to your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You can pee here!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Ahahaha... haha.. yes I can, of course. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's okay, the duck's using our bathroom anyway. Hey Joe! What are you getting Kathy for her birthday?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We've only been going out for a couple of weeks, do you think I gotta get her something?

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, you have to get her something, and it should be something really nice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I know...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And not one of your coupons for an hour of "Joey Love."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooo, a crossword! Can I help?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! I'm sorry, honey, it's just that last week I got all but three answers and I really want to finish a whole one without any help.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine. But you can't help me develop my new universal language.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, how'd it go?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow--the dead-guy-from-today's best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mon! I'm so happy for you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff. Look at this! I'm an omelet station! Omelet? Made to order!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'll have one, please. Plus my money.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I didn't realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I... I used it to buy all this stuff. But look--I've got another job tomorrow, so I'll pay you back with the money I make from that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Oo, sorry I acted like a bank.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh...

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Um, would you like to come in?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did homo-erectus hunt with wooden tools?

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: According to recent findings!

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Here Mitzi! Here Mitzi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mitzi is.....

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: My hamster. I hope she's okay, I haven't seen her in a while. Have a seat.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh... Oh hey, do you, uh ...do you have any, um, Cinnamon Fruit Toasties?

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I do! Why don't we go back to my place, light a couple of candles, break open a box of Cinnamon Fruit Toasties, uh...

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: I'd rather not.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, why not?

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Okay, um, don't take this the wrong way, but your place kinda has a weird smell.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, is everything in the car?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes. Did you settle the bill?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No. I hate this part.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, look what we almost left.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, that's not mine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, all right. Oh! Look what we almost took!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Excuse me, Mrs. Burkart? Well, we're all cleaned up in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: Oh, good. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um, and, well there's the.. the the small matter of...

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: Dear?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just the matter of ...payment?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: Jack used to handle the finances!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know what we should all do? Go see a musical.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you know which one we should see? The 1996 Tony award winner. Do you happen to know the name of that one?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't know... um, Grease?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rent?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! Rent!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, so when do you want to go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Oh, I'm sorry, I can't, I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. Man, it is so hard to shop for girls.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, it is, at Office Max.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What did you get her?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A pen.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's two gifts in one. It's a pen that's also a clock! Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Huh-huh! You can't give her that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because she's not eleven! And it's not the seventh night of Hanukkah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, honey, what he means by that, is ...while this is a very nice gift, maybe it's just not something a boyfriend gives?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure it is! She needs a pen for work, she's writing, she turns it over.... "Whoa! It's time for my date with Joey!"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, look, look. What did... what did you get for Angela Delveccio for her birthday?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She didn't have a birthday while we were going out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: For three years?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, it's too late, and I got an audition. I can't shop anymore! I...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right. I will go out and I will try to find something for her, okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks, man. And oh, while you're at it, could you get her a card?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Would you like me to write her a little poem as well?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Or... just get a card that has a poem already in it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But Mon, you have to get our money!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, Phoebe, she couldn't stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know, it's tough. You know what the first thing I did after my mother's funeral was?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Pay the caterer! Look, I've had a lot of jobs, okay, and there are some people who just always try to get out of paying. It's either, you know, "that massage wasn't long enough, or, "I don't recognize any of those songs," or, you know, "these sombreros aren't big enough. Bad little white girl!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. So what do you.... you think she's faking?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it seems like there weren't any tears 'til you showed her the bill.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: You're a grand ol' flag, you're a high-flying flag, and forever in peace may you wave....

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She seems fine now.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: ...emblem of the land I love. The home of....

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, you just left? Her place was really that bad?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know how you throw your jacket on a chair at the end of the day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, like that, only instead of a chair, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of a jacket, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of the end of the day, it's the end of time, and garbage is all that has survived! Here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow. Thanks. So, uh, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you mean? Nothing happened! I had to get out of there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, so... next time, you take her to your place.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I tried that. She says it has a weird smell.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What kind of smell?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know. Soap?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, listen, Ross... you like this girl, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You wanna see her again, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you're gonna have to do it in the mess!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, okay you're right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I mean, uh, who... who cares about a little sloppiness?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's, uh... it's endearing, really.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Now you go get that beautiful pig! Oink!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, all right. I just spent the entire afternoon looking for a present for Kathy that would be better than the rabbit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I found this great place called "Invisible things for Kathy." Can you give me a hand with all this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, look. Why don't you just return the book, let Joey give her the clock pen, and you give her something worse than that. Like... a regular pen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She's really going to love this, you know? The bottom line is I want her to have it, even if I don't get to be the one who gives it to her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aw, honey, that's so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah? You don't think it's just pathetic?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Pathetic!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I'm meeting Kathy in ten minutes! I've been looking all over for you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Our place, the hall! I...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I got something for her. It's a book!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A book? Is it like a book that's also a safe?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it's a book that's just a book, okay? It's an early edition of the Velveteen Rabbit. It was her favorite book as a kid. So, uh, just... let me know if she likes it, okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it. Thanks man. Thanks for doing this, I owe you one. Oh, hey! There wasn't any change from that twenty, was there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it came out to an even twenty.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow. That's almost as much as a new book.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those eyes?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You didn't get the money, did you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on... you know what? Let's just go!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Hey, we're not leaving until we get paid! I don't know who she thinks she is! Enough is enough! Hey, widow?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: Come on along and listen to...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, Widow!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: ...the lullabye of...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Excuse me. Excuse me! Thanks. Um, clearly this is a very, very hard time for you. Um, but, um, we provided a service, and we deserve to be paid because you ate that service, and, um, we are not leaving here until we're paid every penny. 'Cause you know what, lady? We're part time caterers, and we have no place else to go.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
utterance.content: All right. I'll get my bag.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm gonna leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: So you want to come inside?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes. Yes I do.

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: I'll be right back. Make yourself comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Guess who?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Department of Sanitation?

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: It's me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Ah. Aw!

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, Cheryl!

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Oh, Ross!

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Wait! No! No! It's my hamster! It's Mitzi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my god! I'm so sorry, Cheryl. I must have freaked out.

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Oh, thank god, it's not Mitzi. It's just a rat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I did it! Oh! I finished it! I did it all by myself! And there's nobody to hug!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Move!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, you guys, I finished the crossword all by myself! Hug me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh... yay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that's great! Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you! Hey, how'd the catering go?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn't pay, so Phoebe yelled at her 'til she did.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. I'm a hard ass.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And I'm a wuss. And we should be partners.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Hard Ass and Wuss. We could fight crime!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! You're not working right now, and we have such a great time together!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can cook and you can take care of the money.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh! It'll be like I have a wife in the fifties!

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, how'd it go? How'd she like the gift?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, man, she loved it! She's over there showing Monica and Rachel right now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah? That's great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, listen, I gotta tell ya, I feel kinda bad taking credit for this, because man, am I gonna get a lot of credit for this!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Aahhuuhhh....

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Happy birthday.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know, uh... Chandler got you a gift, too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No he didn't.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, he did, look... look, it's right there on the counter! Ha-ho-ho!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Happy birthday! I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: You really didn't have to. Wow.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See, you think it's just a pen, but then you turn it over and it's also a clock.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Yeah. No, this is great. Thank you, Chandler. .

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah... yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah. Hm. Wanna go to bed?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: I'll be in in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, uh... don't forget your coupon. .

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Um, thank you for the gift.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, uh, yeah... I just knew that sometimes when you're writing, you... you don't always know the exact time.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: No, I... I didn't mean the pen. Thank you for the book.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, the book?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: The Velveteen Rabbit. I kinda have the feeling you had something to do with it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Well, uh, when Joey gave it to me, he said, "This is 'cause I know ya like Rabbits, and I know ya like cheese." Thanks. I love it. And I know how hard it must have been for you to find.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uhl..ell. By the way, in case you missed that, that sound was, "Uhl, ell."

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: You must really like... Joey... to go to all that trouble for him.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, he's my... he's my best friend.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Well....

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, that coupon expires, you know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi. Uh, you... you don't know me, I'm Monica Geller... Ross's sister.

utterance.speaker: Cheryl
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Oh, you know, that's too bad that didn't work out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn't sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No?
